Server

Class ConnectionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Server.ConnectionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ConnectionHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    Manages a single TCP connection with a Player. It handles some of the logic for client to client-user communication and sends the commands through to the ServerController and GameController with which it doesn’t do anything itself.
    Author:
    Stephan

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionHandler

        public ConnectionHandler(ServerController newController,
                         java.net.Socket newSocket)
        Creates a BufferedReader connected to the inputstream of this socket. Creates a PrintWriter for writing to the Client. Retrieves the supported extensions from servercontroller Sends EXTENSIONS command to start communication Sets the Flag for the run() method to true Sets the gameController to null to allow checking if a MOVE command is correct Sets nickName to nickName Unknown
        Parameters:
        controller - //the current ServerController
        socket - /the socket created by the ServerController

      • run

        public void run()
        Waits for a new line. When one is received sends it to the commandReader. Is only active when listenForCommands == true. If it is set to false the kick() method is used to free up resources.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • setGameController

        public void setGameController(GameController newGameController)
        Sets the GameController attribute for referencing when in a game
        Parameters:
        newGameController - the current GameController

      • setNickName

        public void setNickName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the NickName for this Player
        Parameters:
        name - the NickName

      • writeToClient

        public void writeToClient(java.lang.String message)
        writeToClient uses the native printWriter of the ConnectionHandler object to send a line to its client. It also displays the message on the ServerGui
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be send

      • commandReader

        public void commandReader(java.lang.String newLine)
                   throws Error
        Switches all the commands in the AMULET protocol to the right parts of the system using a switch If there is a violation of the AMULET protocol it throws an Error with a descriptive message. The Closing of the thread and of any games is handled in the run method.
        Parameters:
        newCommand - a new Command which has been detected
        Throws:
        Error

      • kick

        public void kick()
        This Client is being kicked. Too free up resources the bufferedReader, writer and socket are closed and the connection is removed from the ServerController
